contextId.information: Here "I" refers to Moses. The phrase "at that time" refers to when the Israelites were at Horeb, which is the same as Mount Sinai. AT: "When we were at Horeb, I spoke to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: I spoke to you at that time

contextId.information: This means the time when they were at Horeb, at Mount Sinai. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: at that time

contextId.information: God commanded the Israelites to attack and destroy the Amorites, but the Israelites were afraid and refused to fight them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Yet you refused to attack

contextId.information: These are descendants of the Anak people who were very large and fierce. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
contextId.quote: sons of the Anakim

contextId.information: This refers to when Moses disobeyed what Yahweh told him to do because Moses was angry with the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh was angry with me because of you

contextId.information: Why Joshua stands before Moses can be stated clearly. AT: "who stands before you as your servant" or "who helps you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: who stands before you

contextId.information: The people of Israel were related to the descendants of Moab. Moab was the son of Lot. Lot was the nephew of Abraham. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the descendants of Lot

contextId.information: The people of Israel were related to the descendants of Ammon. Ammon was the son of Lot. Lot was the nephew of Abraham. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: to the descendants of Lot

contextId.information: Moses reminds the tribe of Reuben, the tribe of Gad, and the half tribe of Manasseh that they must help the other Israelites conquer the rest of the land God promised them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: I commanded you at that time

contextId.information: This refers to when Moses disobeyed what Yahweh told him to do because Moses was angry with the people of Israel. Translate this as it is in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:01:37|1:37]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh was angry with me because of you

contextId.information: The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "because of the sins you committed at Baal Peor" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: because of Baal Peor

contextId.information: This refers to when Moses disobeyed what Yahweh told him to do because Moses was angry with the people of Israel. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. Translate this as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:01:37|1:37]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh was angry with me because of you

contextId.information: This can be made more explicit. AT: "that is in the earth beneath your feet, or that is in the water below the earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water below

contextId.information: Some translations read "to a thousand generations of those who love me." The word "thousands" is a metonym or hyperbole for a number too many to count. AT: "to thousands of people, to those who love me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
contextId.quote: to thousands, to those who love me

contextId.information: Here "listen" means to obey, and "them" refers to Yahweh's commandments. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "listen to Yahweh's commandments, statutes, and decrees" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: listen to them

contextId.information: The Israelites of the earlier generation had asked Aaron to make a metal calf so they could worship it. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: molded for yourselves a calf

contextId.information: The tribe of Levi did not receive a portion of the promised land when they arrived there. The full meaning of this statement may be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: no portion nor inheritance of land

contextId.information: Moses is referring to an event in the past when Dathan and Abiram rebelled against Moses and Aaron. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab

contextId.information: The people could only kill animals as sacrifices in the place that Yahweh would choose. They could kill animals for food anywhere they wanted. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: However, you may kill and eat animals within all your gates

contextId.information: The blood represents life and God did not allow the people to eat the blood along with the meat. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: But you will not eat the blood

contextId.information: God's law specifies which parts of the animal are for the burnt offering, which parts are for the priest and which parts are for the offerer to eat. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "you will eat some of the meat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: you will eat the flesh

contextId.information: The tribe of Levi did not receive a portion of land as their inheritance. Their share of the inheritance was the honor of serving Yahweh as his priests. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: for he has no portion nor inheritance with you

contextId.information: It is implied that because the year of release will happen soon, the person thinking this will be reluctant to help a poor person since it is likely that the poor person will not have to pay him back. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: The seventh year, the year of release, is near

contextId.information: This was the name of the unleavened bread. The full meaning can be stated explicitly. AT: "this bread will remind you of how much you suffered while in Egypt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the bread of affliction

contextId.information: The people had to leave Egypt so quickly that they did not have enough time to make bread with yeast in it. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "out of the land of Egypt in such hurry you did not have time to make bread with yeast in it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: out of the land of Egypt in haste

contextId.information: They were to build roads so that it would be easy for people to travel to these cities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: You must build a road

contextId.information: "to save his own life." The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "so the family of the man who died does not kill him to get revenge" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: to live

contextId.information: "but did not hate his neighbor before he killed him." This implies there was no cause for him to kill his neighbor purposely. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: and did not previously hate him

contextId.information: "to one of these cities to save his own life." It is implied that the family of the dead man may try to get revenge. The man who killed him can flee to one of these cities, and the people there would protect him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: to one of these cities and live

contextId.information: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "hides and waits in order to kill him" or "plans to kill him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: lies in wait for him

contextId.information: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "You must not take land away from your neighbor by moving the markers on the borders of his land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: You must not remove your neighbor's landmark

contextId.information: This means the two persons must go to the sanctuary where Yahweh's presence dwells. At the sanctuary are priests and judges who have the authority to make legal decisions for Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: must stand before Yahweh, before the priests and the judges

contextId.information: People considered an army with many horses and chariots to be very strong. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: and see horses, chariots

contextId.information: One of the officers' jobs was to decide who could leave the army. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: The officers must speak

contextId.information: She will do this after the man brings her to his house and when she shaves her head and cuts her fingernails and toenails as mentioned in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:21:10|21:12]]. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "she will take off the clothes of her people and put on Israelite clothes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: she will take off the clothes she was wearing

contextId.information: You may need to make explicit that the man sleeps with the woman. AT: "But if you sleep with her and then decide that you do not want her as your wife" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: But if you take no delight in her

contextId.information: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "he has accused her of having slept with someone before he married her" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: he has accused her of shameful things

contextId.information: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "And then the mother and father will show the clothing with the bloodstain to the elders as proof that she was a virgin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Then they will spread the garment out before the elders of the city

contextId.information: The Israelites at that time thought of a man and woman who had engaged each other for marriage as husband and wife. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "because he slept with a girl who belongs to a fellow Israelite" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: because he violated his neighbor's wife

contextId.information: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "they did not welcome you by bringing you food and drink" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: they did not meet you with bread and with water

contextId.information: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "a slave from another country who escaped from his master and came to Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] )
contextId.quote: a slave who has escaped from his master

contextId.information: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "But, if you do not make a vow, you will not sin because you will not have a vow to fulfill" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: But if you will refrain from making a vow, it will be no sin for you

contextId.information: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "but you may not put any grapes in your bag to take them away with you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: but do not put any in your basket

contextId.information: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "after she has become unclean by the divorce and remarriage to another man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: after she has become impure

contextId.information: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "so that he will have his coat to keep himself warm when he sleeps, and he will be grateful to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: so that he may sleep in his cloak and bless you

contextId.information: A lender would take something from the borrower to ensure that she would pay him back. He was not allowed to take her coat because she needed it to stay warm. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "and do not take a widow's cloak as a pledge because she needs it to stay warm" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: nor take the widow's cloak as a pledge

contextId.information: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "must go up to the city gate where the elders judge cases" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: must go up to the gate to the elders

contextId.information: Here removing the sandal symbolizes that the brother would not receive any of the property of his dead brother. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. This can also be stated in active form. AT: "The house of him whose sandal his brother's widow took off his foot" or "The family of a man who did not marry the wife of his dead brother" or "The family whom everyone despises" or "The family who is shameful" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The house of him whose sandal has been taken off

contextId.information: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. You can also make clear the understood information. AT: "You must not cheat people by using a weight that is larger than you say it is when you buy things and by using a weight that is smaller than you say it is when you sell things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: You must not have in your bag different weights, a large and a small

contextId.information: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. You can also make clear the understood information. AT: "You must not cheat people by using a measure that is larger than you say it is when you buy things and by using a measure that is smaller than you say it is when you sell things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: You must not have in your house different measures, a large and a small

contextId.information: Here "impure" means the person is unclean according to the Law. God does not allow an unclean person to touch the tithe he is giving to God. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "when I was unclean according to the Law" or "when the law says I cannot touch it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: when I was impure

contextId.information: Plaster is usually a mixture of lime, sand, and water that is spread on something. It dries to form a hard, smooth surface on which a person can write. AT: "spread plaster on them" or "make them so you can write on them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: plaster them with plaster

contextId.information: This refers to the chisels that would make the stones smoother, in order that they might fit together better. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit.  AT: "you will not shape the altar stones with iron tools" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: you must raise no iron tool to work the stones

contextId.information: The full meaning of the statement can be made explicit. AT: "who takes land away from his neighbor by moving the markers on the borders of his land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: who removes his neighbor's landmark

contextId.information: You can make clear the implicit information. AT: "what is good and will cause you to live, and what is evil and will cause you to die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: life and good, death and evil

contextId.information: Moses is probably referring to food crops. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "the best fruits ... the precious fruits" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: finest things ... precious things

contextId.information: Olive oil was used for food and for the skin of the face and arms. Feet were dirty, so to put the foot in olive oil was to ruin valuable oil. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "have so much olive oil that he can afford to waste it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: dip his foot in olive oil

contextId.information: Cities had large bars across their gates to keep enemies out. The meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "May you be safe from attacks by your enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: May your city bars be iron and bronze
